title: [K-12] Self-directed Mathematics Inquiry Program for Gifted and Advanced Students

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental arithmetic operations and comprehension of basic mathematical concepts
context.additional_context: Utilizes smartphone-based simple content, with periodic feedback sessions between teachers and students

learning_goals: Learners can independently select an inquiry topic within two weeks and develop a step-by-step learning plan
Learners enhance their ability to revise strategies during problem-solving through at least three self-assessments

During a 6-month project-based task process, learners will use self-directed inquiry questions (at least two per quarter) in over 80% of tasks, and achieve an average score of 3 or higher (out of 4) on intrinsic motivation indicators (curiosity, voluntary participation, creativity) in teacher observation records and peer evaluation checklists

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
